and and sure it might just sound like I've over exerted myself or overworked a

that's just the way it is it is a bit different it's the way it is but the thing is
these don't things don't just pop up overnight right they come creeping up on

it's hard to explain it's like somebody pulls a veil over your eyes it's like somebody pulls this thin piece of fabric

everyone and everything that you have near you and the weird thing is that
it doesn't matter how much The Logical side of me understands that this is happening and that is stupid and that

honestly everything around me that interrupts me I I have been known to yell at my phone for vibrating

I don't eat I can't sleep and I forget to do like every important thing in my

with large number of projects and short deadlines if the current project wasn't fun three

and I kept going back to Korea for for several appointments until she won they said

so that was interesting but I think the most interesting thing about this
book for me or one of the most interesting things was that it actually it looked at ADHD from a scientific

drd47r is a special dopamine receptor that you have in your brain it's in 15
to 70 percent of the human population depending on where in the world you look it's geographical
and it's likely involved in causing the things that we call ADHD it's not going
to cause ADHD on its own because it's part of a bigger dopamine system but it is highly connected to the traits
that we call ADHD so the general idea with drd7r drd47r
sorry is that it's less sensitive than a normal dopamine receptor which causes the reward system in the brain of a
person with this receptor to work a little bit differently so because it's less sensitive it's less
likely to pick up on small rewards that you get for stuff like taking out the trash watching a sunset or hugging
these were examples from the book and I actually found the hugging part really really funny
that sounds weird I know but my wife has for years told me that I suck because I

apparently your brain is supposed to get small rewards for that and feel this nice comfy feeling for an extended

I might have a weird dopamine system I can now explain why I don't like long hugs hopefully

apparently that's not the way I'm supposed to react and it might also explain why I'm so

because these Sports tend to or activities tend to release loads of

about the fact that I had this ability I I just didn't understand that it wasn't
something that everyone else was experiencing so if you don't know what hyper focus is it's pretty much what it sounds like

the time has passed at all and somebody forces me to eat something but the thing is I thought everyone had

in hours it's really really hard on me and even things like that aren't
